solution_line_template: Doris babysits for a total of {weekdays_per_week} weekdays x {hours_per_weekday} hours/weekday = <<{weekdays_per_week}*{hours_per_weekday}={weekday_hours}>>{weekday_hours} hours
She babysits for a total of {weekday_hours} + {saturday_hours} = <<{weekday_hours}+{saturday_hours}={total_weekly_hours}>>{total_weekly_hours} hours in a week.
She earns {weekly_hours_for_earnings} x ${hourly_rate} = $<<{weekly_hours_for_earnings}*{hourly_rate}={weekly_earnings}>>{weekly_earnings} in a week.
So, it will take ${target_earnings}/${weekly_earnings} = <<{target_earnings}/{weekly_earnings}={weeks_needed}>>{weeks_needed} weeks to earn Doris needed amount.
